messages.content:
Answer:
The fair use statute has undergone numerous amendments since its inception. Key changes include:

- A 1990 amendment to Section 107 by the Visual Artists Rights Act of 1990, which added subsection (a)(1) to consider the primary purpose and economic effect of use on the market.
- Further amendments in 1992 and 1997 made additional provisions regarding architectural works and pre-1972 sound recordings, respectively.
- Subsequent acts have made further modifications to the fair use statute, including revisions by the Intellectual Property and High Technology Technical Amendments Act of 2002 and the Architectural Works Copyright Protection Act of 1990.

These amendments have affected various sections of the fair use statute, including sections 107 and 108.
I’m a Title 17 assistant. I can only answer questions that are clearly about U.S. Copyright law (Title 17). Please rephrase your question to reference the relevant sections or concepts.

Answer:
The satellite carrier must make a good faith effort to negotiate a reasonable license with each copyright owner who has a significant portion of the public performance of the work. The license must be negotiated before May 1, 2019, and be enforceable against the satellite carrier in a proceeding under section 1201. Additionally, the satellite carrier must give notice to each copyright owner of its intention to make a determination under subsection (a), and the court may order a determination upon receipt of.
